abstract.text: Displays a simple HUD window containing a progress indicator and two optional labels for short messages.

inlineContent.text: To still allow touches to pass through the HUD, you can set hud.isEventDeliveryEnabled = true.
HUD is a UI class and should therefore only be accessed on the main thread.

abstract.text: The HUD delegate object. Receives HUD state notifications.
A layout guide that tracks the keyboard’s position in your app’s layout.
Displays a simple HUD window containing a progress indicator and two optional labels for short messages.
View covering the entire HUD area, placed behind contentView.

This is an activity count that records multiple shows and hides of the same HUD object.
Find all unfinished HUD subviews and return them.
A Boolean value that controls the delivery of user events.
Creates a new HUD. adds it to provided view and shows it. And auto hides the HUD after a duration.

HUD subview that hasn’t finished and returns it.
Grace period is the time (in seconds) that the invoked method may be run without showing the HUD.
The view containing the labels, button and indicator (or customView). The HUD object places the content in this view in front of any background views.

The minimum time (in seconds) that the HUD is shown. This avoids the problem of the HUD being shown and than instantly hidden.
